content: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights, adopted by the United Nations in 1948, established fundamental human rights to be universally protected. It has influenced numerous national constitutions and international treaties.
The P versus NP problem asks whether every problem whose solution can be quickly verified can also be quickly solved. It remains one of the most important unsolved problems in computer science.

Portfolio diversification reduces risk by spreading investments across different assets that are not perfectly correlated. Harry Markowitz's Modern Portfolio Theory provides mathematical framework for optimal asset allocation.

Earthquakes occur along faults, which are fractures in the Earth's crust where rocks have moved. The San Andreas Fault in California is a famous transform boundary between the Pacific and North American plates.

Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape. Predicted by general relativity, they form when massive stars collapse and were first imaged by the Event Horizon Telescope in 2019.
